sub_title: Scientific Support Assistant at EMA - European Medicines Agency | MSc Political Science - Political Legitimacy and Justice | BSc Social Work
summary:
I have a Master of Science in Political Science from Leiden University, with a specialisation in Political Legitimacy and Justice. Focused on Political Philosophy, I participated in courses such as “Legitimacy and Political Obligation”, “Transnational Politics of Human Rights”, “Contemporary Debates on Justice”, and other general courses involving the main debates in Political Science, International Relations, Public Policy, Ethics, and academic and professional skills.

I also have a Bachelor of Science in Social Work from The Federal University of Rio Grande do Sul (UFRGS), Porto Alegre, Brazil. Concerning this academic experience, besides having participated in extracurricular activities (extension and research), I also worked for two years in the public healthcare sector. My main experiences were at the Clínicas Hospital of Porto Alegre (HCPA), where I worked at the Infectology Department with People Living with HIV/AIDS (PLWHA), and at the Support House, with children and teenagers (from 0 to 18 years of age) who were treated in the Oncology, Hematology, General Pediatrics, and/or Transplants Services of the Hospital.

Before joining the academic life, I carried out different types of work, having also lived for four and a half years in Italy (at two different times) and one year in England, which provided me with significant personal and professional experience. Leaving my comfort zone strengthened me as a person and made me acquire a new perspective on life, making me a more resilient and independent individual. 

I am passionate about political and moral philosophy, correlated with normative ethics, public administration, justice, institutional and administrative processes, and social development matters. My whole academic path was built upon my interests in these fields of study. Social Work is an interdisciplinary social science that aims to understand and intervene in societal/social issues. Likewise, my choice for the master's programme in Political Philosophy was based on my intentions to contribute to social development, aiming to act as a more prepared transforming agent.
I have always advocated for a transdisciplinary approach, trying to work through a multidimensional lens, for I consider intellectual pluralism to be essential for advancing scientific knowledge in a liberal, plural society. I truly believe in this, and I think it is a valuable perspective to advocate for.

profile_positions.description:
I work as a Scientific Support Assistant at the Committee for Medicinal Products for Human Use (CHMP), the committee responsible for human medicines regulation in the European Union (EU). I am part of the Meeting Secretariat Office team, who is responsible for planning, organising, and running the committee's scientific and regulatory meetings.

Role summary:
Organise and run human medicines scientific and regulatory meetings; provide comprehensive administrative and technical support to committees and their chairs, members, and experts in liaison with other EMA functions. Enable best meeting outcomes and publication thereof. Support management of the human medicines scientific committees membership, the handling of the declarations of interest of the members and alternates of the human medicines scientific committees, and the management of the experts' database.
profile_positions.title: Scientific Support Assistant

•   Helped with the development of lesson plans for the Core Module - International Relations course.
•   Pol-Sci Pressure Cooker Programme 2023 Trainer - China’s role in International Financial Institutions: investing in strategic autonomy? | IIS - Institute for Interdisciplinary Studies (1.5 EC).
